Since this tests part activation, I'm suspicious of the changes that were made
for the 16:00 build, although this is for views not editors.
Chris or Doug, what was the nature of the changes?

I made one change for the 8 p.m. build.  The change was in 
WorkbenchCommandSupport, and dealt with how the internal command structure 
responded to part activation.  It did not change the nature of part activation 
itself.

What necessitated the change?  Since it was working before, it seems like there
is a deeper problem with part activation.  Does the change/workaround you made
shed any light on this?

Nick, I don't think I understand.  The problem that I fixed was local to 
commands. 
 
There was a second fix to editor workbook, which I'm not sure I can explain 
fairly.  But, as it was, both of these fixes went into the 8 p.m. build -- not 
the 4 p.m. build.  This test failure was detecting while making the 4 p.m. 
build.

Nick: 

An error was introduced last week in command/handler processing by the key
bindings in dialogs work. This error was the cause of a number of bugs (about 6
in my list) related to keys running handlers in wrong parts. The error yesterday
was clear and the fix is sound.

The second fix (in EditorWorkbook) was to tell the editor presentation to
setActive(false) when it was deactivated. This change affects rendering of the
editor presentation only, and you will notice that the editor tab now draws as
'inactive' when you select a view. (the 'third state' for editor tabs is still
missing, but i feel that showing 'inactive' is much better than showing 'active'
in this case for today)

Both of these problems, especially when combined, suggested a fundamental
problem with part activation but in both cases were really something much less
scary.

It is possible (almost certain) tat there are still problems related to focus,
I'll be assessing these (along with others, stefan, etc.) today.

Thanks for clarifying.  

Doug, are you still seeing the test failure on your machine?
I'll have a look at it on Windows and make sure that the activation sequence is
happening properly.
fyi. the command/handler bug is bug 55651.
